page.title: 10VILLAGE BUSINESSES 1
page.content: The village shop is a general store and has served the village for over 100 years. It serves about 50 customers a day, mostly for groceries. It delivers on Saturdays over a 5-mile radius. The stock comes by van from Plymouth. It is also a sub-post office supplying stamps,pensions and licences A home-based man and wife make wooden furniture, loose covers and upholstery They also renovate antiques and export furniture to the U.S.A. The undertaker and funeral director arranges funerals with the Rector and supplies the coffins. He makes them from oak or pine wood. The wood is bent using boiling water to prevent it breaking. He screws the parts together and fits metal handles. He fits a plinth to cover the screws. Nowadays most coffins are ready made. His hearse is a black Ford Granada.
